summary:
## Atlantic Hurricane Season

The Atlantic hurricane season runs from June 1 to November 30. This is when most tropical storms and hurricanes form in the North Atlantic.  On average, 14 named storms happen each year, with 7 becoming hurricanes and 3 becoming major hurricanes. The strongest storms usually happen in late August and early September. The busiest season was in 2020 with 30 named storms.
title: Atlantic hurricane season
